front.title: Packet-Based Paradigm For Interfaces To NSFs

abstract.t: In the design of interfaces to allow for the provisioning of network- based security functions (NSFs), a critical consideration is to prevent the creation of implied constraints. This draft makes the recommendation that such interfaces be designed from the paradigm of processing packets on the network. NSFs ultimately are packet-processing engines that inspect packets traversing networks, either directly or in context to sessions to which the packet is associated.
